summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on the Central African Republic, adopted Resolution 2264 (2016) at its 7617th meeting on 9 February 2016. The Council, noting the situation in the Central African Republic continues to threaten international peace and security, decided under Chapter VII of the UN Charter that MINUSCA will comprise up to 10,750 military personnel, 2,080 police personnel, and 108 corrections officers. The Secretary-General is requested to continuously review the levels of personnel in MINUSCA. The Council decided to remain actively seized of the matter.
